hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util

Class FunctionIterable

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util.FunctionIterable

  • public final class FunctionIterable
extends Object
    The functional iterable support with anamorphism, bind and catamorphism. http://blogs.bartdesmet.net/blogs/bart/archive/2010/01/01/the-essence-of-linq-minlinq.aspx
    Author:
    akarnokd

      • ana

        public static <T> Func0<Func0<Option<T>>> ana(T seed,
                              Func1<T,Boolean> condition,
                              Func1<T,T> next)
        Anamorphism that creates Ts starting from the seed value until the condition holds. Its equivalent is a for loop: for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the values to generate
        Parameters:
        seed - the initial value
        condition - the condition until the Ts should be produced
        next - the way of compute the next T
        Returns:
        the function of founction of option of T

      • cata

        public static <T,R> R cata(Func0<Func0<Option<T>>> source,
           R seed,
           Func2<R,T,R> aggregator)
        A catamorphism which creates a single R out of the sequence of Ts by using an aggregator. The method is a greedy operation: it must wait all source values to arrive, therefore, do not use it on infinite sources.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the sequence values
        R - the intermediate and output types
        Parameters:
        source - the source of the sequence values
        seed - the initial value of the aggregation (e.g., start from zero)
        aggregator - the aggregator function which takes a sequence value and the previous output value and produces a new output value
        Returns:
        the aggregation result
